titlepage.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the Russia. Legatsiia (Hesse, Germany) Records, 1857-1913
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1999 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Correspondence, reports, circulars, instructions, telegrams, and printed matter, relating to Russian-German relations

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Russia. Legatsiia (Hesse, Germany) Records, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1929

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

did.unittitle: Journey of their Majesties Emperor Alexander II and Consort, 1857
Correspondence with the Duke of Nassau concerning the dowry of the late Grand Duchess Elizaveta Mikhailovna, 1857-1862
Journey of their Majesties Emperor Alexander II and Consort, 1864-65
Journey abroad of Emperor Alexander II accompanied by Grand Duke Vladimir Aleksandrovich, 1867
Telegrams on the war with Japan, 1904
Journey of Emperor Nicholas II and the Imperial Family, 1896
Minister-Resident Baron Knorring in Darmstadt and Koburg, 1909
Confidential correspondence between the St. Petersburg Foreign Office and the Russian Representatives Abroad
Governor-General of the Amur District. Khabarovsk, 1911-13
Circulars and instructions of the Foreign Office to Russian Representatives Abroad
